item.title: Ubisoft Lays Off Yet More Employees at Massive and Stockholm
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft is engaging in yet another round of layoffs, this time targeting The Division developer Massive Entertainment and Ubisoft Stockholm, which will lose around 55 employees between them.

As reported by Gamesindustry.biz, the layoffs at Massive are technically different from those announced in October last year, which took the form of a voluntary redundancy program employees could engage with if they wanted to.

This time, however, the layoffs aren't voluntary, and they're split between Massive and Ubisoft Stockholm, which is working on Ubisoft's Scalar cloud platform. It's not clear exactly which departments will be most affected by this latest round of staff cuts.

According to GI.biz, the aforementioned voluntary redundancy program "had some takeup", but Ubisoft deemed "additional steps" were necessary in order to further cut costs.

An internal email sent by Ubisoft to staffers apparently states that the layoffs are nothing to do with staff performance and that the direction of both studios remains the same.

Just in case you need a reminder, Massive Entertainment is the studio behind 2024's Star Wars Outlaws, and it's also the developer responsible for Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora and the Division franchise. A third installment of said franchise is currently in the works.

It's been a shaky start to the year for Ubisoft. Just last week, the studio shut down its Halifax branch, a decision that carried with it some pretty unfortunate timing; Halifax had become the first North American Ubisoft studio to unionize just weeks before its closure.

These layoffs and studio closures are part of a wider set of cost-cutting measures for Ubisoft; the publisher also cut staff at Trials developer RedLynx in October as well, so I wouldn't be surprised if more cuts are on the way.

We'll have to wait and see how else Ubisoft plans to reduce its spending, but I'm betting we haven't heard the last of job losses (and potentially even studio closures) from the publisher. Stay tuned for more.

item.title: Arc Raiders Sales Officially Pass the 12m Mark
item.content:encoded:
Arc Raiders sales have soared past another huge milestone, according to developer and publisher Embark Studios, and there's a lovely free gift waiting for you to claim by way of a thank you.

As revealed on social media earlier today, Arc Raiders has now sold 12 million copies, which means that in the time between mid-November and now, the game has racked up a whopping eight million more sales for itself. Not bad at all.

The free gift in question is available until 11:59pm CET today (that's around 5:59pm Eastern), and it was originally prepared for Arc Raiders hitting 10 million sales, but as Embark says, players "blew straight past [that milestone] over the winter break".

News of Arc Raiders' new sales milestone accompanies a rather small patch that was released earlier today; it's not a big one, but you can check out the patch notes here if you want to know what's changed.

If you're not familiar with Arc Raiders, it's an extraction shooter created by Embark Studios, the company responsible for destructo-FPS The Finals.

Set on a "lethal future Earth", Arc Raiders sees you (and, optionally, your buddies) taking on massive monsters that now stalk the land, as well as other survivors who may not have the best intentions.

Arc Raiders' success probably won't come as a surprise if you checked out Steam's list of best-selling games from 2025 earlier this year, although it is also one of several games on that list to openly use generative AI, which is a controversial topic in the industry right now.

If you want to see what all the fuss is about, then you can check out Arc Raiders right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Stay tuned for more on this one.
